<CIResizeBehavior> Convenience MethodsCIRect provides several methods for the most common resizing behaviors for both width and height.
CIRect.WidthOfWindow()Resize width to the width of the window
CIRect.HeightOfWindow()Resize height to the height of the window
CIRect.WidthOfSuperview()Resize width to the width of the view’s parent view (superview)
CIRect.HeightOfSuperview()Resize height to the height of the view’s parent view (superview)
CIRect.WidthOfView(view)Resize width to the width of the specified view
CIRect.HeightOfView(view)Resize height to the height of the specified view
CIRect.TallestSubviewOfView(view)Resize height to the height of the tallest subview of the specified view.

Positioning Behaviors<CIRect.positioning> determines how the CIView will be positioned.

CIRect

A CIRect defines the size, origin, clipping and positioning for an object, usually a CIView.  CIRect provides several convenience methods for building CIResizeBehaviors.  Extends CIObject.

Summary
Functions
initialize(configuration)
toCssStylesObject(css, superview)Convert this CIRect to an Object defining CSS Styles
isEmpty()Tests if this CIRect is of an empty size and does not have an origin
isEmptySize()Tests if this CIRect is of an empty size (no width nor height)
isEmptyPoint()Tests if this CIRect does not have an origin (no x nor y)
hasSize()Tests if this CIRect has a size (width and height)
hasOrigin()Tests if this CIRect has an origin (x and y)
getHeight()Accessor Override.
getMinWidth()Accessor Override.
getWidth()Accessor Override.
getX()Accessor Override.
getY()Accessor Override.
<CIResizeBehavior> Convenience MethodsCIRect provides several methods for the most common resizing behaviors for both width and height.
CIRect.WidthOfWindow()Resize width to the width of the window
CIRect.HeightOfWindow()Resize height to the height of the window
CIRect.WidthOfSuperview()Resize width to the width of the view’s parent view (superview)
CIRect.HeightOfSuperview()Resize height to the height of the view’s parent view (superview)
CIRect.WidthOfView(view)Resize width to the width of the specified view
CIRect.HeightOfView(view)Resize height to the height of the specified view
CIRect.TallestSubviewOfView(view)Resize height to the height of the tallest subview of the specified view.

Functions

initialize(configuration)

initialize: function(configuration)

Configuration

minWidthInteger or CIResizeBehavior.  The minimum width of the CIRect.
widthInteger or CIResizeBehavior.  The width of the CIRect.
heightInteger or CIResizeBehavior.  The height of the CIRect.
xInteger or CIResizeBehavior.  The horizontal position of the CIRect.
yInteger or CIResizeBehavior.  The vertical position of the CIRect.
clippingString.  The CIClippingBehavior of the CIRect.  Defaults to <CIClippingBehavior.Clip>.
positionString.  The CIPositioningBehavior of the CIRect.

toCssStylesObject(css, superview)

toCssStylesObject: function(css,
superview)

Convert this CIRect to an Object defining CSS Styles

Parameters

cssObject.  Optional CSS styles to override or extend the generated styles
superviewCIView.  Optional superview the CIRect will use when resolving CIResizeBehaviors

Returns

Object

Example

new CIRect({
    width: 100, height: 150, y: 20
}).toCssStylesObject({
    color: 'red', width: 150
}) => {
    width: 150,
    height: 150,
    y: 20,
    color: 'red'
}

isEmpty: function()

Tests if this CIRect is of an empty size and does not have an origin

Returns

true or false

getHeight()

getHeight: function()

Accessor Override.  Returns the height of this CIRect, resolving its CIResizeBehavior if necessary

Returns

Number

getMinWidth()

getMinWidth: function()

Accessor Override.  Returns the minimum width of this CIRect, resolving its CIResizeBehavior if necessary

Returns

Number

Accessor Override.  Returns the width of this CIRect, resolving its CIResizeBehavior if necessary

Returns

Number

Accessor Override.  Returns the horizontal position of this CIRect, resolving its CIResizeBehavior if necessary

Accessor Override.  Returns the vertical position of this CIRect, resolving its CIResizeBehavior if necessary

Returns

Number

<CIResizeBehavior> Convenience Methods

CIRect provides several methods for the most common resizing behaviors for both width and height.

CIRect.WidthOfWindow()

Resize width to the width of the window

CIRect.HeightOfWindow()

Resize height to the height of the window

CIRect.WidthOfSuperview()

Resize width to the width of the view’s parent view (superview)

CIRect.HeightOfSuperview()

Resize height to the height of the view’s parent view (superview)

CIRect.WidthOfView(view)

Resize width to the width of the specified view

CIRect.HeightOfView(view)

Resize height to the height of the specified view

CIRect.TallestSubviewOfView(view)

Resize height to the height of the tallest subview of the specified view.  Note: This does not return a CIResizeBehavior, but an anonymous object that responds to toInteger() and compares the subviews’ heights.

CIClippingBehavior

CIClippingBehavior is an Object of String constants that define the available behaviors when a CIView’s content exceeds the boundaries defined by its CIRect.

Summary
Constants
Clipping Behaviors<CIRect.clipping> determines what happens when the content exceeds the boundaries of the CIRect.

Constants

Clipping Behaviors

<CIRect.clipping> determines what happens when the content exceeds the boundaries of the CIRect.

CIClippingBehavior.AutoScrollUse scrollbars, but only show them when scrolling is necessary
CIClippingBehavior.ClipClip the excess content at the boundaries of the CIRect.  This is CIRect’s default.
CIClippingBehavior.ScrollUse scrollbars
CIClippingBehavior.DoNotClipDo not clip the excess content

CIPositioningBehavior

CIPositioningBehavior is an Object of String constants that define how a CIView can be positioned in the page.

Summary
Constants
Positioning Behaviors<CIRect.positioning> determines how the CIView will be positioned.

Constants

Positioning Behaviors

<CIRect.positioning> determines how the CIView will be positioned.

CIPositioningBehavior.FlowFlow from left to right, top to bottom and ignore the CIRect’s X and Y.  This is CIRect’s default when CIRect.isEmptyPoint is true.
CIPositioningBehavior.AbsolutePosition the view from the top-left corner of the page.  This is CIRect’s default when CIRect.hasOrigin is true.
CIPositioningBehavior.RelativePosition the view from the top-left corner of the view’s superview.
CIPositioningBehavior.FixedPosition the view from the top-left corner of the page and do not scroll it within the browser window.

Accessor Override.
CIView is CIP’s generic visual component.
A CIRect defines the size, origin, clipping and positioning for an object, usually a CIView.
CIResizeBehavior allows a CIRect to calculate the integer value of a target variable at any given time by delegating the retrieval of the variable to a function.
The base class from which all CIP classes inherit.
CIClippingBehavior is an Object of String constants that define the available behaviors when a CIView’s content exceeds the boundaries defined by its CIRect.
CIPositioningBehavior is an Object of String constants that define how a CIView can be positioned in the page.
